intro: Adenocalymma marginatum var. polystachyum, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the humid regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red, with five petals and a prominent central column. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. The species is characterized by its branched inflorescences, which can produce numerous small flowers, contributing to its ornamental value.
